website_summaries.verdict: Effective training collar with chrome prongs that will resist damage, even when used regularly.
pros: Works especially well for large dogs that tend to pull hard on the leash
Can purchase replacement links to easily change the size of the collar
Secure connection with metal materials throughout
Prongs have blunt ends so they don't puncture the dog's skin
cons: Prongs can become tangled in fur of dogs with long hair

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you get a real Herm. Sprenger collar!!
customer_reviews.text: Received a fake collar the first time. Replacement collar was a real one. I own the 3.0mm version of this collar, so I knew how the real one looks like. The fake collar looked like the cheap prong collars you get at the pet store. Make sure the collar you get has "HS", "SPRENGER", and "HS GERMANY" stamped on the various pieces. Check the picture I attached. Fake on the left, Real on the right.
customer_reviews.author: leo

customer_reviews.title: Received imitation collars twice now.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered twice. Both times I received a collar that is not Herm Sprenger. It was missing the center and end plates, it was not stamped by Herm Sprenger, and the prong ends were not rounded off and had rough metal shavings still attached. Please look your items over very carefully. I ended up going to the Herm Sprenger website and buying direct.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda L.

customer_reviews.title: The prong collar works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: Training my female German Shepherd has been a challenge. She is insanely smart and rebellious and acts like a wild ping pong ball on our walks. I have two shepherds and out of the two, she is the most defiant. They are well trained in every regard, except for the natural pulling issue all dogs have while they are on walks. So I tried this collar. My God. After one walk, her pulling was drastically reduced. I'm a believer.
customer_reviews.author: Rictor J Riolo

customer_reviews.title: Fake Herm. Sprenger Training Collar
customer_reviews.text: I already own a Herm. Sprenger 3.25 mm Training Collar and was looking to buy a second. The collar I received is a fake, drastic difference in size, weight, and quality. The diameter of the prongs should measure 3.25 mm. What I received measure 2 mm. What were they thinking???
customer_reviews.author: David Schornack

customer_reviews.title: stupid "features"  to rate this product BUT HERM SPRENGER i.....
customer_reviews.text: is the best and ONLY Prong collar you should buy. They are the industry standard and the metal won't fail if your dog pull (it's rare!) They are made in Germany with craftsmanship! The majority of dogs ONLY need the 2.3 mm size prongs....Read how to use these PROPERLY on Upstate Canine Academy, YouTube...Tom Davis gives excellent instruction. They are NOT meant to be devices of punishment but rather like power steering on a car....for communication only...To remind your dog...."Hey, listen to me..."
customer_reviews.author: kitch-n-Things

customer_reviews.title: Skin Sensitivity issues
customer_reviews.text: I bought this collar on a recommendation from a family member. I received my item pretty quick. After using it a couple days . I found this collar starts leaching or turning the hair collar dark..and not very pretty. While it is perfect for training your pet . After speaking with a H.S. rep. He told me this is a know Issue. He also recommend a more hypo allergenic that they manufacture. I highly recommend this type of collar configuration. It has made every aspect of training easier .  .
customer_reviews.author: Christine Schobert

customer_reviews.title: Knock off Collar
customer_reviews.text: Buyer Beware - this collar is not a herm sprenger brand as noted in the description. Returning based on this.
customer_reviews.author: RNigro

customer_reviews.title: One of the best purchases in a long time
customer_reviews.text: I have a 95 pound doberman who is pretty well behaved. He walks on a loose leash when there is nothing going on, but when he gets excited he pulls pretty hard. After I got this, I watched two youtubes from solidk9training (watched others but his were the best) and holy moly, just a flick of your wrist to communicate with your dog with this collar on and what a nice structured walk! Also, I used their measurement guidelines and based on that I bought the biggest size, but then I had to remove 3 links!!! I am not sure why they have you measure and then add four inches.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Pruszynski

customer_reviews.title: Zero, THIS IS A KNOCKOFF...😠
customer_reviews.text: It's a fake, not a Herm Sprenger. I've had a genuine HS for twelve years, I've included a photo for comparison, a star is required, it should be 0 - 5, this is a zero.
customer_reviews.author: Panzer H.

customer_reviews.title: Knock Off Collar
customer_reviews.text: This is not a real HS collar it looks like a fake has blunt edges, not the rounded ones like the real Sprenger . I’ll be returning.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: This is not quick release.
customer_reviews.text: To be clear, there is nothing wrong with the product. The description does not match the photo or intended product. I already own 1 quick release for my dogs. I bought a second here but it is not quick release. Just be forewarned. Still a great product from a reputable company. Just Amazon isn’t selling what’s intended. Photo included for comparison. The amazon bought product is on the left. A true quick release is on the right.
customer_reviews.author: David Reliford

customer_reviews.title: Life Changing!
customer_reviews.text: Holy hell! I hated taking my 60 lb german shepherd pup for walks because he would pull so hard. He would walk in front of me, side to side, and stop everywhere he shouldn't. I had just about decided to give up when I came across the reviews here. What a difference! I went from near full exertion of my dominant arm to walking him with my pinky finger - literally. Do yourself a favor. Quit debating and spend the 30 bucks.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Legit
customer_reviews.text: Legit Herm Sprenger. I was a little hesitant after seeing some reviews and photos of obvious fakes from China. I received a real Herm Sprenger. Great quality.
customer_reviews.author: D gallagher

customer_reviews.title: OFF IT COMES
customer_reviews.text: .....My K9 in training shakes his head and the collar falls off. This is not good, this is dangerous. He’s off lead with the shake of his head. The collar comes undone 2 out of 5 times. I would like to replace or return.....but.....too late.
customer_reviews.author: Shane

customer_reviews.title: CANT RECOMMEND THIS ENOUGH!
customer_reviews.text: Can’t recommend this pinch collar enough !!!! My 6 month old 70lb American Bully would pull me really bad. I walk him while pushing my baby in a stroller, so I needed a training tool to fix the pulling A S A P because I was afraid he’d pull the stroller over. NOW When I walk him with this collar on he is a different dog! people tell me he is so trained. He walks right by the stroller and stops to sit when I stop. Life saver !!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Neeka

customer_reviews.title: Be careful with sizing
customer_reviews.text: The sturdiness is a little over the top with this collar. I bought for training my adult rotti, measured carefully, read sizing instructions from the company website and it still was too tight. There should be some play in the fit but this was really tight and very heavy, bulky and impossible to use as it's supposed to be used. I think people are better off going to a trainer to get fit properly. This is an important and often improperly used training tool
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best dog product!!!
customer_reviews.text: Best dog products I ever purchased! My 18 months old GSD (120 lb) is over active and walking him was challenge. He would give me (5' 10" 165lb man who works out every day) an additional workout and my kids could never walk him, because of pulling. He is extremely well behaved and good listening dog but among other dogs and it was always a challenge... to the point his walks were trough private woods... With this collar, it is a huge difference. He pulled for about first 5 seconds... And that's it. Rest of a 2 hour walk was at kneel position and an apsolute enjoyment. From now on he is getting public walk every day!
customer_reviews.author: srdjan sudar

customer_reviews.title: I can finally walk my dogs now
customer_reviews.text: I have a German Shepherd and an Akita mix dog, we've struggled to walk them and haven't liked other options as they seem a but cruel or uncomfortable. However, we can finally walk our boys even at the same time. It is a lifesaver and they both seem very comfortable when using the collars. Our shepherd is HUGE at over 100lbs and is very strong, the akita has super thick hair and coat so we were worried these wouldn't work. 100% recommend and are so thankful we found these.
customer_reviews.author: RGDO

customer_reviews.title: Great prong collar at a reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: I had originally given this collar a stellar review, however, now that we have had it for a while, I have to amend that. I thought I was buying a quality collar, however, when I saw that the fur around my dog's neck was changing colors, I took a closer look. The collar was rusting! I had never experienced this with a prong collar previously, and I am very disappointed now to have to purchase another collar. If you are looking for quality, my suggestion is, go elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Hootie

customer_reviews.title: Bad customer service
customer_reviews.text: My dogs nail got stuck. I returned them. I got a refund then they charged me for them. Said i didn't return them. When I definitely did. Both my dogs are scared to death of them. I bought no pull harnesses. They work wonders. Dont recommended.
customer_reviews.author: daisy

customer_reviews.title: Durable and great for training
customer_reviews.text: My dog is a pain in the butt with normal collars and harnesses. When we did training with him the trainer recommended a prong collar. I know not everyone is on board with them, but it does teach the dog and doesn’t harm them. Overall, I love this collar. It’s durable and the links are easy to take off for size. The only reason I gave it a 4 star is I’m not a fan that there’s no easy way to take it on and off. It has to go over their head or you have to undo a link.
customer_reviews.author: Jordyn Grinnell

customer_reviews.title: 5 thumbs up
customer_reviews.text: My dog practically pulled my arm out of its socket. The collar stopped him pulling and now walks are fun for both of us. Getting the collar on can be difficult it is hard to squeeze prong ends to go in collar attachment holes but don’t let that deter you, it is a great product! I was leery because it looks dangerous, watched three YouTube videos on it, the collar is completely safe.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I'm a believer, but.......
customer_reviews.text: I've tried 6 different "no pull" collars or harnesses in the past few months and this is the ONLY one that has actually worked. I tried two other pinch type collars which did not work. My Pit actually pulled so hard wearing one of them that the collar broke. I watched two videos on YouTube which showed the correct way to use the Herm Sprenger collar and I strongly recommend doing that before using it. Honestly, the results are amazing. I'm a believer. BUT....it's not easy to put on or take off. Still, I'm willing to deal with that part in order to walk my dog without having my shoulder come out of joint. :)
customer_reviews.author: Liz Swenson

customer_reviews.title: Immediately helped stop a dog from pulling
customer_reviews.text: I didn't want to use one of these collars, so I ordered a no-pull harness. However, the harness was just a bit better than the regular collar, didn't help a lot. But just got back from a walk with this collar, and wow, he just didn't pull. Made walking so much easier! Also, seemed to be a genuine Herm SPRENGER, unlike some other reviewers who didn't seem to get genuine products. Amazon was the actual seller of the product I purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Ross Mendel

customer_reviews.title: Keeps my 90 lb Yellow Lab under Control
customer_reviews.text: We adopted a 109 pound yellow lab that wasn't walked much by her previous owner. When she saw another dog, she'd take off. After one such incident, I wound up in the ER with a busted up chin from falling as she pulled me. This collar helped me to take immediate control of her. Now that our walks are more enjoyable, she is able to go 4 miles a day and has already lost 19 pounds (and I haven't fallen again). A gentle leader also worked with our girl to stop her from pulling, but she hated wearing it!. She doesn't mind this collar at all.
customer_reviews.author: rat

customer_reviews.title: Works very well
customer_reviews.text: I read the long articles about this collar and they are correct. It works very well, it does not hurt the dog (we have a 7 month old male golden retriever who pulled like a sled dog), and my wife (73 years old) can walk him now. So it does the job. It is a little tricky to put on, especially if the dog is jumping all over the place like ours does, and if you have limited strength in your hands like my wife does, it can be a struggle to get on and off. But well worth it. Great quality. We live at the beach, and have seen no signs of rust, so that is great too.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Should've bought this sooner
customer_reviews.text: I've owned e-collars, easy walk harness, gentle lead and my 3 yr old 85lb Chocolate lab pulls so hard when he locks onto a sent or wants to great another dog. I know it is most likely an issue with me and not being consistent with training and lease manners. This pinch collar put an IMMEDIATE stop to his pulling after pulling twice. Fit it up high close to his ears making sure that the lead loop is on top. I like that the prongs are rounded off and don't have sharp edges. I tried this collar first on my form arm and it wasn't painful but it wasn't comfortable neither when pressure applied.
customer_reviews.author: M. Goo

customer_reviews.title: My dog still rushing forward, I am afraid it will hurt her.
customer_reviews.text: This is a sturdy dog collar. It does not calm down my dog. She still rushes forward when seeing cats or other dogs. Sometimes I am afraid of hurting my dog. But later she seems fine. so I don't know whether it will hurt dog. so far, I have not find any product which is good for controlling your dog from rushing forward all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Jacky Stanley

customer_reviews.title: Trainer recommend
customer_reviews.text: Our dog trainer recommended a prong collar for our GSD puppy. Specifically this brand. The function is smoother and more even than other prong collars. It releases smoothly and doesn't bind. So your dog gets a correction when and how it's suppose to. We used it in obedience classes, (and once we were confident we were using it right) we used it at the park or when we needed extra control. Our GSD is almost one and we rarely use it anymore. Our trainer said the whole point was to use it until our dog learned to heel, then graduate to a regular collar.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for a difficult dog
customer_reviews.text: I really hate the idea of a pinch collar, but when your dog slips a conventional collar and attacks another dog... This works perfectly. She can't pull or attack, but she does whine when she is pinched. I find this really difficult to put on and remove. Since this girl doesn't sit for any reason, I just force it over her head. When we are done with the walk, I pull the prongs out to remove it but it IS hard - especially with a wiggly 80 lb dog. I am not saying the design should be improved. As difficult as it is, it works better than I had expected.
customer_reviews.author: J. Kessler

customer_reviews.title: It is a great training tool
customer_reviews.text: Did not know about this collar until our trainer told us we should get one. I so wish I had known about it sooner. I have a 135+ lb dog that has drug me down the road and across river rocks. Since I got this, it has been much easier walking him. The collar does not hurt the dog. It is a great training tool.
customer_reviews.author: Katy Bow

customer_reviews.title: Dog probably likes it less than I do!
customer_reviews.text: This is great! All of the sudden walking our golden is a pleasure! If he pulls even a little bit he backs off, I bought the large size which fits him perfect. Plenty loose when he doesn't pull, but pulls tight enough when he does. If you have a dog that prefers to walk you, and you aren't Caesar or someone who knows how or can spend the time on properly leash training your dog, this is a lifesaver! Ok, that's a bit much. It won't save any lives, but it will make yours a bit easier!
customer_reviews.author: B and B

customer_reviews.title: Life Changing for Dogs That Pull
customer_reviews.text: Our 80 pound shepherd mix would pull nonstop before we got this. It was nearly impossible to take her on walks. Once we put this collar on, she learned very quickly that pulling wasn’t an option anymore. It took her several walks to get used to it, but we’ve been working with her with the collar on for over a month now, and she’s doing amazing. Virtually no pulling, or pulling fixed by a slight correction. I would highly recommend this collar if your dog pulls nonstop. This has been a game changer for us.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Joyner

customer_reviews.title: Great with a downside.
customer_reviews.text: This is a 5 star collar, well made and durable. BUT it has no quick release. In order to remove the collar (recommended after each training session) you must squeeze the prongs to undo them. Not only do I find this awkward but at my age not as easy a task as it might be. I'm sure there is a way to make this collar easier to put on and remove.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Daly

customer_reviews.title: Works wonders!
customer_reviews.text: My shepherd was the worst pup to walk before I got this. He would pull and lead. I’m 8 months pregnant and I was scared to take him for walks with his regular harness and leash because He’s pulled me to the point where I fell down. My neighbor recommended this collar. My pup is like a different dog. It’s not a chore to walk him anymore because He’s easy to walk. He doesn’t lead or pull. He walks right by my side. I’m planning on switching back to his old collar after a few months but this definitely helped in training and efficiently correcting negative behavior.
customer_reviews.author: Cristina Pezza

customer_reviews.title: Great quality collar!
customer_reviews.text: This is our second Sprenger collar for our dogs. We have been very pleased with them, their durability and ability to correct without hurting the dog. The only downside to this collar is that it does not have the clasp to put on and take off. Putting the prongs over our the head of our very excited GSP, can be challenging as we don’t want to poke her in the eyes. I wish this weight came with the clasp for ease of use.
customer_reviews.author: Katrina

customer_reviews.title: Hallelujah
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE these collars. I've had dogs my entire life and recently started pet sitting. I've had 100 pound dogs nearly pull me down the stairs. Walking was such a hassle. No more. These things immediately control that behavior. The dog realizes who is in control and pays attention to you allowing you to walk and train easier. Just make sure to take the collar off after walks - left on all day they can cause a lot of skin irritation. I've since bought three more!
customer_reviews.author: KNS

customer_reviews.title: I can finally walk my Belgian Malinois
customer_reviews.text: Wow, I've tried all tactics to get my dog to not yank the leash and nothing worked. Finally with this collar my dog does not pull and knows exactly how much slack he has. The collar is loose for the most part because he hardly ever pulls now. I can finally walk him without giving me shoulder pain. My Belgian Malinois is only 6 months old!
customer_reviews.author: Folkicks

customer_reviews.title: Great for training and walking a difficult dog.
customer_reviews.text: This was a last resort. Before giving up on my 85 lb. Lab. I only wish there was an easy clasp to snap on. The instructions state to open a link then put it on. Then close it once it’s around the neck.This becomes almost impossible with an active dog. Obviously with a closed loop you have to be careful of the dogs eyes. It does work great. Most of the time my dog walks with a slack leash now so there’s no discomfort. , Well made. I wouldn’t be able to walk him without it.
customer_reviews.author: PICKLES

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, durable, and works however hard to put on
customer_reviews.text: The collar is exactly as advertised...durable, and works. My 60 lb bull terrier mix walks beside me with it on, instead of jerking my shoulder out of socket pulling on the lead. My one complaint is that it is very difficult to put on my pup. He has a large head, and fights having the collar put on. I cannot put it over his head, as the collar would then be to loose with use. So I have to unhook a prong and try to hook it back on with my pup wiggling and flopping on the ground. We ended up buying a different pinch collar with a buckle that works much better for us.
customer_reviews.author: CharRR

customer_reviews.title: Please don’t buy
customer_reviews.text: Please do not buy this collar. There is a design flaw that allows the latch to easily become disengaged and falls off. The photo had a different latch than the one we received. Our puppy died today after this collar fell off and he bolted into traffic. Our hearts are broken and all we have left is this faulty collar that can lose its hold on the chain- I have enclosed a video for you to see what I’m referring to.
customer_reviews.author: EMullett

customer_reviews.title: Instant
customer_reviews.text: We have a 90lb American Bulldog. He would drag me like a kite. I couldn't walk him anymore, only my boyfriend. He put this on our "puppy" and he INSTANTLY stopped pulling. It is a saviour to my shoulders, and my boyfriends knees.
customer_reviews.author: StarcatcherTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Good, not great
customer_reviews.text: It is a good collar. Seems very sturdy and I imagine it will be durable. What is not so good about this particular collar is that it isn’t very easy to put on or take off. I believe there is another model that has a “quick release”. That would have. A better purchase I think.
customer_reviews.author: Joey

customer_reviews.title: Buy it, it works!
customer_reviews.text: I was starting no to walk my dog because she pulls me all over and jumps on people she is too strong for me. Today was different I loved our walk and was so happy that now I can do this. Thank you so much.
customer_reviews.author: Shane

customer_reviews.title: Great teaching tool
customer_reviews.text: During a 5 month heartworm treatment, my 60lb lab/hound/pitty mutt was on exercise restriction and developed some mildly reactive behaviors due to lack of socialization. This prong collar was a great communication tool for him and I. He responded to the prong beautifully with light pressure and quickly learned that if he stayed in a heel position, then there was no pressure! It is VERY quick and easy to put on and take off. I have used it for about 4 months and it is still just like new!
customer_reviews.author: Santina S.

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly, doesn't hurt dog at all
customer_reviews.text: This collar is the one you want if you're working on training for a muscular and powerful doggo. Despite how "menacing" it looks, it DOES NOT hurt the dog. You can put it around your own arm or leg and pull to see what it feels like. It provides that extra tug you might need if you are trying to protect a powerful dog from going somewhere he shouldn't. I have found this to be invaluable as a not so strong female. Recommend. *If you've never used one of these before, get a trainer to help you learn how to use it. It's easy once you are shown what to do.
customer_reviews.author: GoofyGirl

customer_reviews.title: Ok, wouldn’t recommend
customer_reviews.text: I wish I would’ve just spent the extra $10 to get a good one. This one somewhat works, but my good boy still tug and pulls. We usually take him while we longboard anyways, but it would be nice to be able to walk him without pulling on trials we can ride boards on... if you really can’t afford the extra $10 whatever go ahead... I recommend buying a better quality one at your local pet stores or even target or some shizz... have a good day.
customer_reviews.author: TeaLeaf 🍵

customer_reviews.title: No More Pulling; Not Harmful to My Pup
customer_reviews.text: My Lab pup was starting to pull even with Puppy Class, so I decided to get him one of these. Used properly, they do not harm the dogs neck unlike other kinds of metal dog collars. I got some extra links since my boy is still growing & they are very easy to add to the collar. My trainer said to make sure I got this type & not a quick release, so I got this one. Good choice. My 70 pound pup walks very well now; right next to my hip & no pulling!
customer_reviews.author: Judi

customer_reviews.title: An amazing collar
customer_reviews.text: I got this Sprenger collar for my yellow lab (almost 6 months old), which is (was:) a strong puller. This collar made a great difference. The dog still pulls a little, but he learns quickly not to. I just got the collar, so the dog will take some time to adjust. But the difference is night and day. The collar is very effective and safe. Please, do not get discouraged by the "medieval" look. Also, it is very easy to use. I have no problems with removing links (I bought a bigger collar because my dog is a growing pup), opening or locking it. I am very happy with this collar and would recommend it to any dog owner.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Best training collar that is not cruel
customer_reviews.text: Obviously for my dog who walks much better when he wears . I felt guilty when our dog trainer recommended for our 125 lb. German Shepherd. But he explained, the dog is not going to hurt himself on purpose. We had a house fire and had to move to an apartment complex with lots of kids an squirrels. My dog, Reefer, could pull me down while on leash when he wanted to chase animals. In one day, he was trained not to do that. He needed several walks a day, living in that apartment. Our house has a fenced in backyard, so he doesn't have to wear it there
customer_reviews.author: Barbe K.

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend the 3
customer_reviews.text: Upon recommendation from our trainer, we purchased this collar for our puppy. At six months, our puppy was about 75 pounds and difficult to control. He responded very well to this collar. Our puppy is now 100 lbs and I've purchased some extra links for the collar. I've also bought the next size up because I think he is outgrowing this gauge. I would recommend the 3.25mm size for dogs 50-100 lbs. If bigger than 100 lbs, I would go to the next mm size up.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Sabol

customer_reviews.title: Suprisingly effective and gentle
customer_reviews.text: In two training sessions we went from constantly pulling and choking herself with a strap collar to calmly walking by our side. I was surprised how little pressure it takes to correct her and how gentle it allows you to be with her. If you're worried about it hurting your dog like we were, concider that a prong collar she doesn't pull on at all is far kinder than a strap collar she chokes herself with.
customer_reviews.author: ripley

customer_reviews.title: Legit collar, finally found a solution
customer_reviews.text: I have a 65lb one year old golden retriever. We’ve been having a lot of problems with his manners. He’s jumpy, mouthy, and pulls on walks. This collar has fixed it all! I lead him around the house daily and take him for walks, and now his behavior is so much better. He’s still silly and happy, but he’s learning that I’m the boss! :) I got the larger prong collar and had to take out two links, and it fits perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: amy3d

customer_reviews.title: Great for pulling dogs!
customer_reviews.text: Before getting this collar, my dog was horrible to go on walks with. She would pull so hard and it just wasn’t enjoyable. After we put this on her and went on her first walk, she learned really fast that if she pulled it wasn’t a good feeling. I can say it’s 100% better with this collar. It doesn’t hurt her, she doesn’t yelp, and gets so excited when she sees it now cuz we go on a lot more walks. I would 10/10 buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Weinbaum

customer_reviews.title: Helped to Get Dog Under Control
customer_reviews.text: We have a 130lb dog who likes to pull. Not just on walks but when a motorcycle drives by or a kid on a skateboard is going to fast. This collar is great!! Tightens just enough for him to choke himself hard and STOP pulling. We tried other options which didn’t work and made us scared that he may get loose. Looking to stop a strong puller, this is your go to collar.
customer_reviews.author: Davis

customer_reviews.title: Transformed my dog
customer_reviews.text: Holy crap, this thing transformed my young border collie's untrainable, unpleasant, arm-yanking behaviour 100%!! I've tried everything - choke collar, yelling, being nice, etc, to absolutely no avail...it's like he LIVES for pulling with all his heart and soul!! Once the collar is on, he completely backs off and walks normally with his golden retriever brother. I can't recommend this collar enough, great design, well executed, easy to put on & remove. I'll buy another when this one wears out, maybe I'd step up for the stainless...:o) !
customer_reviews.author: S. Ring

customer_reviews.title: Looks Good
customer_reviews.text: For those keeping track at home, I ordered on June 10, 2020 and got legit 20" Sprenger collar.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin M. Jordan

customer_reviews.title: best purchase ever!
customer_reviews.text: 10 stars if I could!! my shepherd pup at 5 months old was about to pull my arm off. I got a workout taking for a walk and not in a good way. I dreaded taking her. obedience classes didn't help with healing. she instantly stopped pulling as if she knew. I don't even think she tried to pull. it was like a diff dog.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Made a big difference
customer_reviews.text: My Pitt pulled me when we walked until I got this collar. This made a big difference in how our walks are now. Wish I had sizes up but I’m glad you can buy additional links to add to it
customer_reviews.author: NotuRgurl

customer_reviews.title: I'm glad I got it.
customer_reviews.text: My dog pulls way less, and my kid can actually walk him now. Can remove and or add links to adjust to my baby's neck. He pulls way less. I know some people are against it but I don't see them walking, i mean cars are bad for the ozone. For a person like me with surgeries and chronic medical conditions but also needs to walk this is great cuz my baby and I get to go out and excercise.
customer_reviews.author: Issa dream

customer_reviews.title: Torture device? 😳
customer_reviews.text: I have a dog that pulls and this was recommended to me. I was told it looks scary, but doesnt hurt. I put it on my forearm and squeezed as if it was my dog pulling. It hurt and left me the marks for nearly an hour. Not using it and returning it. I will continue trying more humane ways of teaching him not to pull.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Best collar
customer_reviews.text: 10/10 I have a pit bull who is way stronger than me and made waking him a mission because I would be dragged but instantly when I took him out with this collar he was a different dog. He knew right away if he doesn’t pull, it won’t hurt him. I bought this product used also and it’s still great.
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa Jauregui

customer_reviews.title: An extremely valuable collar for great walks!
customer_reviews.text: Out of all the products I have purchased to try and work with behavior of my dogs, this is by far the best product. Since it is a collar it cannot help my dog stop chewing, haha, but it helped tremendously in controlling their behavior on our walks and helped to establish a healthy owner/pet relationship. They are lab pit mixes. This car is a effective. And I would also recommend that you buy the official collar not the imitations. I also watched a video on how to remove the links and that was extremely helpful. And that is another good feature, that you are able to just the caller to fit properly on your dog's neck.
customer_reviews.author: cynthia mora

customer_reviews.title: Ordered Sprenger, was sent low quality imitation instead
customer_reviews.text: I had the same experience as Leo-the collar sent was a very cheap imitation, not the Sprenger I ordered. Sent back for a refund, but you can't expect to get what is pictured. Poor quality metal, and prongs too rough edged to use on any living thing.
customer_reviews.author: customer

customer_reviews.title: It works! No more pulling
customer_reviews.text: I was kinda skeptical but this for sure works with my arm tearing dog, once it goes on he just knows that if he pulls its gonna not feel to great and stays by my side. Took a few runs around the neighborhood but he caught on shortly after. Would definitely recommend to anyone who has a dog that is determined to pull your arm out of your socket to purchase one of these. We don’t keep it on at all times BTW
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Authentic but not quick release
customer_reviews.text: What we received was an authentic Herm sprenger, but it was not the quick release model. I definitely ordered quick-release because I have arthritis, and my client is a 13 year old child.
customer_reviews.author: Charyn Whitaker

customer_reviews.title: Knockoff herm Sprenger prong collar
customer_reviews.text: This is NOT a genuine ' made in Germany ' herm Sprenger prong collar . This is a cheap knockoff with Sharp edges . very disappointing !! Buyer beware
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Save your shoulder from sudden jolts
customer_reviews.text: This is the official collar, in case you were worried because a lot of people said they got knock offs. My only complaint is that you have to slide it over the dogs head. The one we had previously had a clip that made it wider, so you could get the dogs head in easier. That being said, it is doing the job and my shoulder is much happier for it
customer_reviews.author: anniebb

customer_reviews.title: Stop being pulled by your excited dog
customer_reviews.text: This was recommended by my labradoodle puppy’s trainer. It is so much easier to walk him and he fools everyone into thinking he is a calm polite dog (still working on that). He’s so friendly that everyone is a distraction, this collar helps immensely. Makes me want to go for walks. The easy walk harness was good but he still pulled. This collar is just what I needed , I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic training collar, can be hard to get on/off
customer_reviews.text: We got this for my dog when she was a puppy and have used it with her to leash train her. She rarely pulls at all anymore as long as she has this on (2 years old now). The collar shows no signs of rust and is still very strong. It is much easier to put on her and take off now than it was when we first got it, which would be my only complaint.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan

customer_reviews.title: No longer a rag doll
customer_reviews.text: My dog walks me very well. I Was drug like a rag doll in a day care until this collar arrived. All the commands my dog knew but chose to ignore suddenly apply. No pulling barking at other dogs at all. One tug and amazingly I am the one walking and not the one being walked! Thank you sweet baby Jesus!
customer_reviews.author: Ibuyabunchofstuff

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for training
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my 2yr old shepherd. She just pulls and goes crazy when she sees other animals. This worked great because it gives her just enough pinch to know shes not supposed to lunge or try and charge. It's a lot more enjoyable walking her now
customer_reviews.author: Alice Ardis

customer_reviews.title: This prong training collar was a useful tool for training my husky to walk outdoor
customer_reviews.text: This prong training collar was a useful tool for training my husky to walk outdoor. However, it slipped off his neck twice, so i have to wrap a piece of duct tape at the end piece to ensure it does not open. Aside from that it works as indicated. I now walk my dog not he running me. It sort of sticks him in the neck and he instantly howls and stops in his track. He is so obedient on the road, making walking a lot more fun than just a duty to perform. I remove it once he is back at the house. Highly recommend...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My dog is so much easier to walk using this collar
customer_reviews.text: I have a Doberman and he is still a puppy learning how to walk properly. This works really well for him and he doesn't pull me all over the place. At first glance it looks really cruel and dangerous but it just corrects him and teaches him not to pull. I feel like he does more damage to himself on a regular collar because he is able to pull so hard.
customer_reviews.author: SD

customer_reviews.title: was shipped 10 instead of 1
customer_reviews.text: I need to contact whoever for this item. The prong collar works great and I have no concerns. It took one, relatively sedate walk to nearly completely change the experience. Dog doesn't pull, is much better behaved. Excellent training tool that I don't plan to use that often, but has already paid for itself. But I was shipped a pack of 10. Now, I only have one dog, but I'm willing to find out if this has as great a positive effect on other things. I just don't understand how I could put this on my guppies. What am I supposed to do with 10? Finding a use for this is how all those redneck's-now-in-a-hospital youtube clips start...
customer_reviews.author: bitterman

customer_reviews.title: There is hope
customer_reviews.text: Wow what a nice surprise. I had not been able to walk my puppy do to her excitement level and from the first moment I put it on her and she realized things weren't quite as she chose it has been a great pleasure getting to walk with her very effortless. I wish I had this when I first brought her home at 8 weeks would not hesitate to buy again. I have recommended to all who have an excitable pet
customer_reviews.author: Teresa White

customer_reviews.title: Gentle and works great!
customer_reviews.text: Does its job without hurting my german shepherd. I took a few links out and it fit snug right behind her ears. It applies just enough pressure to allow the dog to correct herself without needing to be promted. It is so easy on her neck that she doesnt even notice it unless a correction is being made or if she lunges at another animal (to play, not to attack).
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Stood the test of time! Love it!
customer_reviews.text: My dog hates it, but it’s seriously THE only thing that works when walking the dog. Otherwise he’ll pull our arm off from pulling so bad. We tried a harness first, which worked for the first month, but then he got used to that and started pulling again. This collar has stood the test of time! Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Noelle

customer_reviews.title: I returned this one
customer_reviews.text: I returned this one because I didn't like the way it sat on my pup. It might be good for you but it wasn't good for us.
customer_reviews.author: Devorah Feeley

customer_reviews.title: Great collar!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. We have a large dog that came to us as an adult and is difficult to handle on a leash if not impossible. We decided to get this collar to help us on walks and it has been the best purchase I’ve made for him so far. Within the first walk he realized that if he lunged it would be uncomfortable, and now he walks like a dream with a slack leash with or without this collar on. It has helped us teach a nearly uncontrollable dog how to be the bestest boy. Durable, dependable, great value.
customer_reviews.author: Bethany Gomez

customer_reviews.title: No pulling!
customer_reviews.text: Great for teaching your dog how to walk on a leash. We were hopeless after trying many different techniques, harnesses, and collars. This is the only thing that keeps her from pulling so we are able to train her appropriately now. My dog has a large head and this doesn’t easily slip on or off so we do have to undo one of the links. It’s not the easiest but totally worth the nice walk!
customer_reviews.author: Ksull03

customer_reviews.title: Stop being skeptical about these collars
customer_reviews.text: If you want to walk your dog and not get walked by your dog this collar will work. Just check out some good advice from professional trainers then you’re ready to go. Once I got this collar sized and introduced to my dog it took about 3 min to get her used to it and was walking next to me from then on. Still working toward weaning her off to walk the same with a flat collar. No more getting pulled down the street or trying to run off chasing squirrels.
customer_reviews.author: Vicky

customer_reviews.title: Great Training Tool
customer_reviews.text: This color was a game changer for controlling my 80 pound Labrador puppy. He was walking OK on a leash but when we would see other people or dogs the pulling was out of control. With the pinch collar it takes very little correction if any now and he does not call at all.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Do

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the money
customer_reviews.text: This collar works but I will need a larger one in a couple of months. I am not sure if they are made that size or where I can get additional links. It is sturdy, and works great with my dog in training.
customer_reviews.author: Loralech

customer_reviews.title: Awful. My dog got out of it
customer_reviews.text: Was taking my Great Dane our for a walk and a husky came running towards us. My Dane broke away from the collar I don’t know how but he did. This isn’t the first time we’ve used this collar so we know what we were doing. Extremely disappointed
customer_reviews.author: MDKS

customer_reviews.title: It works.
customer_reviews.text: The collar does work in allowing me to control my dog. I recently fell and I needed a way to keep him from pulling me. In that regard the collar deserves a 5 star rating. But because of how difficult it is to open the chain links I couldn't give it that high a rating. I can't undo the links so i have to keep the collar bigger in order to slip it over his head. I wish there was a different way to open and close the collar.
customer_reviews.author: mej

customer_reviews.title: Herm Sprenger quality, effective and humane for our cute and fluffy but very alpha Aussie
customer_reviews.text: Seems pretty Herm Sprenger-ey to me. Price was reasonable. Wayyyyyyyy better than the ones in Petsmart. I know it looks a little intimidating, but it really helps our Australian Shepherd pay attention to something other than her own opinions :) We moved up from the small to the medium and it works great for us with two links removed.
customer_reviews.author: Porter Fam

customer_reviews.title: Great training tool!
customer_reviews.text: Springs are SUPER stiff, which makes it difficult to take off/put on, but it's made REALLY well, so I'm happy with it overall. The prongs are well polished so there's no chance of them poking my dogs neck. My dog is also responding very well to the prong collar training. A+!
customer_reviews.author: Sam B

customer_reviews.title: So far so good.
customer_reviews.text: We have tried a few no pull harnesses and always turned away from these spiked collars because they look kinda cruel. This one does not seem to hurt my dog and it actually makes him walk like a normal dog as opposed to a sled dog. I enjoy walking the dog much more than I did before I cannot recommend this enough.
customer_reviews.author: LOU B.

customer_reviews.title: It’s ok
customer_reviews.text: A trainer recommended this brand so I purchased it. After using it a few times, one of the clips would not stay clipped in all the way. It would look like it wanted to unclip and I was worried it would while walking my dog. We returned it because we didn’t want to worry about that one clip.
customer_reviews.author: Erin Meneley

customer_reviews.title: This just works super well
customer_reviews.text: I have a big labrador that used to pull a lot and choke himself with the normal collar on his walk. Since the first moment that I put this one on him, the whole experience changed, he does not pull on walks anymore and his walks are calmer now. This collar won't harm your dog. It just makes your dog uncomfortable when he goes away from you, With just pulling it a little bit, immediately he will correct his behavior. People have a lot misconception about this collar, it really worth it, I am glad I bought it
customer_reviews.author: po11o

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful training tool
customer_reviews.text: One of the best things I’ve ever bought for my dog. This collar is well made with strong material. My dog is a year old and can be very wild and crazy. I put this on her and used it for 30 seconds, Gave her a few very quick pops of the leash and she walked right beside me like a well trained bred dog! I watched some training videos on utube and she is becoming very trainable. This chain does not hurt dogs either. It does not dig in to the skin and the only time it pinches is when she does not behave as she should.
customer_reviews.author: J. Monks

customer_reviews.title: Really helpful
customer_reviews.text: It took me a while to learn how to use it my fiancé had to show me. It was impossible to walk my 100lb lab he could drag you along and i had NO control. So this collar solves that problem. dogs are smart and he learned quickly, that if he doesnt tug, he wont get pinched so no issues, hes never been hurt by it. I only use this for walks not as a normal collar.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca&Roel

customer_reviews.title: Pain to put on and off but strudy
customer_reviews.text: I also have a quick detach one I never use as the clip is janky. I'd use this version over the quick detach despite the extra effort to clip it on and off. Need to keep it pretty tight or my dog will turn himself around and pull his head out.
customer_reviews.author: Trinny123

customer_reviews.title: Only Herm Sprenger! Best Prong Collar Available (Still using one purchased 12 years ago)
customer_reviews.text: I have been using Herm Sprenger prong collars for 15+ years with my Pit-Bulls and Belgian Malinois and they have always been the best! Other "copy-cat" brands from big-box pet stores have literally fallen apart while in use allowing my dog to run free (thankfully he listens to voice commands off leash as well), but my Herm Sprenger's have NEVER failed! I have complete confidence in every Herm Sprenger collar I've ever purchased, one of which is 12 years old and still used to this day.
customer_reviews.author: KiloMal

customer_reviews.title: great sturdy quality
customer_reviews.text: very impressed with quality , sturdiness and ease to adjust links. this is not meant to hurt your pet , but more to just "train" pets, i like the way my German Shephard behaves/obeys just by a lil tug. works better than any collar i have bought
customer_reviews.author: badboyblu2u

customer_reviews.title: A game changer
customer_reviews.text: This collar saved our dog! A miracle worker! I (a 22 year old 120lb woman) have raised our family yellow lab since he was a baby and loved taking him on walks until he became 80lbs and hard to handle! He LOVES cars, unfortunately, and tries to run at any car that passes on a walk, NOT ANYMORE! Now, every time a car passes I bring him into the grass and he sits and waits for it to pass. No tugging, no running, no chasing! We read that this thing is a game changer and we can agree!! Changed our dog!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Donohoo

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put on and helps manage dogs better while on walks
customer_reviews.text: I think this is the best dog walking collar around. First it's easy to put on our dogs and second it really helps control them on our walks without them being put under duress.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy Cerda

customer_reviews.title: Effectiveness
customer_reviews.text: I've tried everything under the sun to make my 80-pound Sheepadoodle (Cash) not pull me constantly when walking him. I really felt I simply wouldn't be able to walk him anymore because my back was being torqued out of whack. I decided to try one more collar I hadn't tried before. Let me tell you- from the moment I put this collar on, Cash stopped pulling immediately! I have been using it for over two weeks now and Cash behaves perfectly and is a pleasure to walk. Trust me, this is the collar to end all collars as far as keeping your dog from pulling!
customer_reviews.author: Doug MacLean

customer_reviews.title: One of my best product purchases ever!
customer_reviews.text: I tried the harness style but my boxer/lab just kept pulling and lunging at other dogs and people (in a playful manner) i watched Jeff from Solid k9 and he recommend this collar and few simple steps to a controlled walk... AMAZING! i was ready to give up walking my dog and now she is so easy and so good on our walks. Only took 1 time and what a difference. We have great walks now. I received the real deal.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany C. Walls

product_meta.title: Herm SPRENGER Ultra-Plus Prong Dog Training Collar
product_meta.description: Color:Silver| Size:3.2 MM x 22"Our HERM SPRENGER Ultra-Plus Prong Dog Training Collar is safe, practical and easy to use. This training collar features a solid fastener plate that provides a more secure connection making fastening the collar around your dog's neck easier and safer. To adjust size, add or remove individual links. The patented center plate construction and symmetrical prong placement provide natural contact for optimal communication. Available in Small (2.25 mm x 12"), Medium (3.0 mm x 16"), Heavy (3.25 mm x 18") and X-Heavy (3.8 mm x 20") sizes. HERM SPRENGER offers a variety of high-quality, specialty chain products.
feature_bullets: Age Range Description: All Life Stages
contains nickel, so will not do for nickel-reactive dogs
